testCases.explanation: For n=7 (binary 111), after increment operations on pairs, maximum AND achievable is 6 (110).
For n=1, only one element, no AND pair possible, result is 0.
For n=4 (100), the maximum AND after increment is 4.

description: Given a positive integer `n`, you can increment any element of the array [1, 2, ..., n] any number of times. Find the maximum bitwise AND of any two elements after all operations.

examples.explanation: Increment 6 to 7: 7 AND 7 = 7? Or increment to make two consecutive even numbers. Max AND = 6.
